@gojomo Yeah, if you randomize.
@gojomo Nope, because the people who opt in aren't random.
@gojomo If your goal is to wait for info, I'd rather administer it to a randomly-selected portion of the population and get real data.

Really, this list of suspicious activities is pretty incredible: http://t.co/4r1MZrk Having the Staples Center schedule?

Perry didn't hold each girl down and stick a needle in their arm; he just added Gardasil to the list of shots required to go to school.
@gojomo All states except Mississippi and WV have this policy: http://t.co/faiOTkX
@gojomo Right to make opt-out. Because of the externalities of herd immunity.
@brianbeutler As @HuffPostHill says, it takes a lot of balls to execute an innocent man.
@Gardasilvictims All we know is they got sick after taking Gardasil. Lots get sick after watching the Superbowl. Should we ban the Superbowl
@Leslieontheedge Getting my last Gardasil shot this week.
@Leslieontheedge Yeah. I think boys should get it too but I think it might not have been FDA approved for them at the time.
@lutherhuffman Can't wait for the paper. There actually was a study that got candidates to give randomized speeches.
@Gardasilvictims There's no evidence Gardasil is responsible for those injuries; people taking other vaccines are injured at the same rate.
@benadida The a { color: white; } CSS makes it hard to see the spec link on http://t.co/MT8m5Z0

@joelittlejohn Write "base ten".

@librarythingtim But there is religion on Sesame Street: Mr. Hooper celebrates Hanukkah, went to Hebrew school. Others celebrate Christmas.

_The Inner Game of Tennis_ belongs with _How Children Fail_ and _Punished by Rewards_ as a must-read trio on how to really learn.
@robbmonn I guess technically they write it rather than say it out loud, but I was speaking casually.
@robbmonn Some people do. I was just criticizing the ones who say "base 10".
@stevenf Was the subtitle an intentional reference to _Database Design for Mere Mortals_ (my favorite book on SQL)?
@stevenf Is there somewhere I can sign up to be emailed when Vol. 2 comes out? Or preorder it? Does it have a title yet?
I never thought a book on How to Count would be so fascinating. http://t.co/HndIVxq Can't wait for the sequel. /by @stevenf
@Andonink Python will stay open as long as your program is still doing anything. Calling raw_input() will cause it to wait for you to type.
@stevenf Would it be better to use / to represent integer division than ÷?
@stevenf I guess the key missing point is the lack of precision is in binary so it doesn't just look like truncation in base ten.
Ah, nice: repr(.2) == '.2' in Python 2.7. Why wasn't it always that way?
@stevenf I'd prefer if you explained more about how floats are stored. But you should at least make it clear that .4==.40000000000000002.
@tuhin Base ten.
@binarybits They should say base ten.
@yoda_2little But what's two in base two? 10. That's true for every base but one.
@beaumartinez Yeah, saying base ten is fine. It's base 10 I'm objecting to.
@stevenf I think your book would be clearer if you said base ten instead of base 10. In base two, base two would also be base 10.
Why do people say they're using base 10? No matter what base you were using, it'd still be base 10 in that base.
@southsouth As a metaphor, it's incredibly deep.
@nicholasstoller I think I overestimated how funny balls were.
_The Joneses_ is the rare film that can't even be described w/o spoiling it. So don't read anything and just watch it. It's fantastic.
Vote @RyanGrim -- his tough-as-nails interviewing style once made @SenatorWicker cry: http://t.co/yixw1st #sorryrogerwicker

@dsquareddigest You don't think banks devise schemes with the purpose of making money?
@dsquareddigest @kendall As http://t.co/JNiOgt2 notes, the US started removing mens rea requirements from many laws in the 1980s.
@dsquareddigest @kendall My point is there is no "knowingly" in the law anymore: http://bit.ly/oEUtxK
@dsquareddigest @kendall Actually, you just have to "devise any scheme ... for obtaining money or property by means of false ... pretenses"
@matthewstoller @dsquareddigest @kendall Ah, thanks -- that's what I was looking for. Text is here: http://bit.ly/nPzs0b
@dsquareddigest @kendall The FBI doesn't seem to think mortgage fraud is a civil issue: http://1.usa.gov/mXXZoQ
